etymologies: Old English ūle, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch uil and German Eule, from a base imitative of the bird's call

definitions: a nocturnal bird of prey with large forward-facing eyes surrounded by facial disks, a hooked beak, and typically a loud call.

notes.text: Order Strigiformes: families Strigidae (typical owls such as tawny owls and eagle owls) and Tytonidae (barn owls and their relatives)

shortDefinitions: nocturnal bird of prey with large eyes, facial disc, hooked beak
